The formula for anion gap is:

\[ \text{Anion Gap} = \text{Sodium (Na)} - (\text{Chloride (Cl)} + \text{Bicarbonate (HCO3)}) \]

However, for the purpose of finding the "delta gap", a formula used to calculate the shift from metabolic acidosis to respiratory compensation is the difference between the anion gap and the bicarbonate level.
